title: Unsure Why I received a Chat Ban
body:
Hi guys. I've been playing League here and there for a while and I find PVP games too toxic so I play Co-op Vs. AI and even then there's people trying to grief me from time to time. This time I was banned, and I don't understand why. I had a Riven (botter/cheater; if you've played bot games you've probably seen some) in my lane feeding the bots so needless to say I'm behind. Then the jungler walks up, takes both the kills before I could secure them, and proceeds to take my cs. I tell him to leave and spam ping him since he has 2 jungles to farm. He replies with spamming his laugh and emotes at me while taking my farm. It's frustrating so I let him know that he's griefing and will receive a report from me.

There's the backstory of how it began, thus an argument occurred about whether or not what he was doing was in any way breaking the established code of conduct. IMO both of us were annoyed at each other, but neither of us were verbally toxic.

It's ironic how during this argument I was trying to explain the ban system to him, then I'm the one getting banned and don't understand why. Lol

Could someone please enlighten me on how to deal with difficult people like this in the future on League? Also point out what I did wrong here. I want serious responses please, as I seriously don't understand why I'm being punished. Thank you for your time.

*It should be noted I've never received a punishment before on League at all, and that I just lost all my honor rank I was working so hard for :/

Hey buddy... sorry that this happened. If you happen to have queued with a team of 4, and if they all report you then the algorithm pretty much gives you a penalty.  It does not matter if they are wrong to report you. It happens all the time, young immature folks will gang up on an innocent person and mass report 1 person for fun because they know how the system works. Go to the support section of the league website and ask for assistance. If you explain clearly, they will remove the honor block and chat restriction and ACTUALLY slap a penalty on the other morons instead. 
HOWEVER, if they played aweful and you raged them it would still put you in the wrong no matter how wrongly/badly they played.
That is bullshit, actually.

What part is bullshit??  The block removal and honor block removal actually happens, i witnessed it. People can mass report on 1 innocent person resulting in penalty. There is no tribunal now, it's just a math equation.  If you are wrongly reported you need to open a support ticket and they do look in to it. Those who abuse the reporting function suffer worse in the end, they not only get penalties but their future reports become weighted less and less. When it is time for them to correctly report someone, it wont do anything.. So important to use reporting function correctly.....

Reports do not cause punishment, and number of reports have no impact.

It is a bad excuse for angry trash that needs an excuse to be the underdog victim, instead of accepting they are angry trash. There is no logical reason why riot would implement that, and it would be more complex than the real system.

Any number of reports from any source triggers an automated review, which does not take the standing or behavior of the person reporting into consideration.

Think of it this way, i report truly toxic players and i am quite forgiving to most behavior, but the truly toxic ones i do report. So believe me, these do not get reviewed unless its a player which has been reported countless times. Otherwise most first-time penalties do not go through review.

Or try this, report someone who is being completely racist, like crazy racist. You will see no instant feedback report, unless multiple ppl report that person. I have reported players for vulgar behavior and offensive language witj very little results. If you are saying that reports are reviewed only by people then you are saying they are ok with racism, which doesnt make sense.

You are replying to the wrong person.

Incidentally, you are correct. Minor infringements are handled automatically and only reviewed if disputed. Bans and suspensions are reviewed. But that has absolutely nothing to do with number of reports having any impact on outcomes.

However, had I done what I now know is the right thing to do, he would've gotten away with it. I could have immediately muted him, not said a word, put up with him constantly spamming laugh in my face as he steals my kills/cs, then reported him in the end... He wouldn't have been banned.

Because I explained why I'm reporting him in chat and excessively argued with him, it resulted in both our bans.

Like you said, trolls are allowed in here. So in my eyes this is somewhat of a justice being served to him with some collateral damage to myself.

From this point on though, I'm just muting immediately. It's not worth the trouble and sooner or later they'll mess with the wrong person again.
